UML:TaggedValue.value: Description It has to be possible to integrate new systems/subsystems based on a new architecture into an old environment. Measure to check Subsystems developed for new architectures can be integrated to old system environments. Rationale New architectures can be used within old system environments. Reference GENESYS R4.1.2.1.4 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 1

Description It should be possible to integrate precompiled modules. Measure to check No source code is needed to integrate software modules. Rationale Suppliers that want to protect their intellectual property may only provide precompiled code. Reference GENESYS R4.1.2.1.1 WP: 1,2,3 Ranking: 5

Description It has to be supported by the architecture to integrate legacy systems/subsystems/nodes. Measure to check Standard interfaces for legacy systems are provided. Rationale A system does not have to be built from the scratch. Old systems can be mirgrated to a new architecture. Reference GENESYS R4.1.2.1.3 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Software modules require a defined execution environment that offers standardized interfaces for software modules. Measure to check The execution environment provides standardized interfaces. Rationale Standardized interfaces of the execution environment allow to develop software modules independently from each other by different develpers. Reference GENESYS R4.1.2.1.2 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description It shall be supported by the architecture that content (e.g., music, video, etc.) can be bound to a license and usage is restricted to the conditions given in that license. Measure to check Licenses for digital media are enforced by the architecture. Rationale Many digital media providers require DRM. Reference GENESYS R4.1.1.1 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 1

Description User should have the control of the system any time and receive info from the system status or action Measure to check Rationale User must feel assisted by the system, Reference R2.2.20.10 Soprano, R2.2.20.11 Soprano, R2.2.20.16 Soprano, R2.2.20.7 PAarsona, R2.2.20.1 Persona WP: 4,3,2,1 Ranking: 4

Description User must feel the system provide a better assistance than not having it Measure to check Subjective measure based on questionaires or interviews. >90% of users agree with the statement after 3 months of use Rationale Benefits of having a system like this should overcome the inconveniences in order to be accepted by users Reference PERSONA R2.2.20.4 WP: 4 Ranking: 5

Description The system must not be designed as a full replacement of personal cares of relatives, neighbours or friends Measure to check The number of contacts from relatives and neighbours shall not decrease Rationale Users don't want to stop receiving personal care, they wouldn't use this service if they think so Reference PERSONA R2.2.20.9 WP: 4 Ranking: 5

Description System shall act as a motivation factor for keeping the elderly active Measure to check At a reference frequency defined after 1 month of service operation and validated after the first 3 months of a service operations, the 80% people must use the system in the same or higher average frequency Rationale The user has to feel that using this service is possitive for his health. He shall obtain positive messages as he completes the activities. This way, he would get motivated to keep using the service Reference R2.2.20.11 Persona WP: 4,3,2,1 Ranking: 4

UML:ClassifierRole.name: Functionality & data in target system components

UML:Package.name: Functionality & data in target system components

UML:ClassifierRole.name: Shared profile data in user context

UML:TaggedValue.value: Description handle shared profile data as part of user context in order to facilitate more powerful reasoning based on both user capabilities / preferences and context data published by context providers Measure to check Rationale shared profile data, as opposed to application-specific profile data, is an important part of the user context and hence can be used in the course of context reasoning Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 3
Functionality & data in target system components

Description A shared understanding of context data, a unique language for the exchange of such data, and a brokering mechanism are needed in order to reduce interdependencies at the development time Measure to check Rationale facilitate the extensibility of the framework and the free plug-and-play of both context providers and context consumers Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5
Functionality & data in target system components

Description guarantee the availability of contextual data independently from the abilities of their original providers to keep a history or answer queries Measure to check Rationale fill the gap caused by context publishers that provide no query interface and / or cannot maintain the whole history of data provided by them, this way guaranteeing the essential support to reasoners that perform statistical analysis and need context stored over time Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5
Functionality & data in target system components

Description provide a general framework for reasoning about context (estimating the state of some context elements by combining different known information and applying certain methods of aggregation, statistical analysis, and / or logical deduction) Measure to check Rationale If for certain needed contextual info there is no provider that can report about it (e.g., no sensor to measure if someone is just relaxing or is already asleep), then, special context providers may be needed as to derive such info using aggregations, statistical analysis, and / or logical rules, to name the most common methods. Such context providers are normally called context reasoners or interpreters. Context reasoning is the major use case for playing both of the provider and the consumer roles simultaneously. Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 4
Functionality & data in target system components

Description provide a pull (synchronous query) mechanism so that components can query the shared knowledge about context at any given time based on a certain query language Measure to check Rationale context consumers may need to access the shared knowledge about context only in certain situations, maybe not only to retrieve the most up-to-date but also historical data, maybe not targeting just one info item but a combination of them Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5
Functionality & data in target system components

Description provide mechanisms to reduce the overhead of initializing profiling data Measure to check Rationale experience shows that profiling data can get very complex very quickly; initializing this data manually is normally a cumbersom task that could lead to problems with use acceptance; different mechanisms can be applied, e.g., using default data based on streotyping methods in combination with machine-learning methods or simple incremental collection / correction of profile data so that each portion of profile data is manually collected / corrected the first it becomes necessary Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2,3 Ranking: 4
Functionality & data in target system components

Description The UI framework must instruct a selected component from the presentation layer how to present a dialog by passing an appropriate set of adaptation parameters to it { e.g., voice gender and volume level in case of selecting the voice-based presentation) Measure to check Rationale the share of the presentation layer in adaptation (content-related to be done by applications, device & modality selection to be done by the UI framwork, and "layout"-related to be done be the presentation components) Reference Analysis of the realization of the PERSONA use case in its internal report 3.1.2 WP: 4,3,2,1 Ranking: 4
Functionality & data in target system components

Description Provide a push (asynchronous subscribe/publish) mechanism for notifying subscribed components about changes in the context as soon as changes interesting for them take place Measure to check Rationale prompt reactivity to certain changes in context that lead to certain situations of interest belongs to the basic principles of ambient intelligence as the enabling technology for AAL Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5
Functionality & data in target system components

Description The UI framework must provide applications with facilities to easily access relevant context and personalization parameters that may affect the process of preparing the content Measure to check Rationale applications may consider such parameters in the process of preparing the content to be presented to the user. E.g., adaptive applications may choose the content language or prioritize (e.g., through context-aware sorting) or emphasize different portions of info differently Reference Analysis of the realization of the PERSONA use case in its internal report 3.1.2 WP: 4,3,2,1 Ranking: 4
Functionality & data in target system components

Description It must be a matter of configuration to introduce new value that can be achieved through aggregation over existig values Measure to check Rationale reduce the development costs by reuse based on modular development principles Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Architecture should enforce modularity when defining its components Measure to check Architecture follows a modular definition approach Rationale AAL systems must be developed modular enough to allow the substitution and improvement of all of its parts, no matter if at the platform or at the application level, just by minimal affections to the operation of the overall system Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Measure to check Container system to host modules is specified Rationale the modularity of AAL systems necessitates that they are based on a (distributed) "container" system that hosts the modules and manages their life cycle Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Keep the mandatory core configuartion small and allow the system to be configured on a per user basis even at the level of components to install Measure to check Flexible configuration is possible Rationale the bigger the mandatory core of a system, the rigider the system configuration and the more complex the system deployment; adaptability not only at the level of behavior of components but also at the level of the selection of the system building blocks Reference PERSONA_additional WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Embedded system (e.g. set top box) should be supported as a communication platform Measure to check Rationale Depending upon its technical capabilities at the time of the project's realization, we will integrate those functionalities that are feasible to install. Reference Task force workshop WP: 2,4 Ranking: 4

Description PC platform to host the runtime environment should supported Measure to check Rationale Some functionalities may require a device with high technical capabilities Reference OASIS R4.2.1.3 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 5

Description Embedded system (e.g. set top box) to host the runtime environment should be supported Measure to check Rationale Depending upon its technical capabilities at the time of the project's realization, we will integrate those functionalities that are feasible to install. Reference Task force workshop WP: 2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Smart phones/pda/tablet to host the runtime environment should be supported Measure to check Rationale Depending upon the smartphone technical capabilities at the time of the project's realization, the functionalities, we will integrate those functionalities that are feasible to install. Reference OASIS R4.2.1.6 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 3
Description PC platform during development supported Measure to check Rationale Used during the development phase Reference OASIS R4.2.1.2 WP: 2,3,4 Ranking: 5
Description PC platform used in maintenace should be supported Measure to check Rationale Needed for system maintenance Reference OASIS R4.2.1.1 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 5

Description TV as a communication platform should be supported Measure to check Rationale TV is the most familiar device for elderly and they won't need to learn to manipulate a new device Reference OASIS R4.2.1.4 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 5

Description Smart phones/pda/tablet should be supported as a communication platform Measure to check Rationale Depending upon the smartphone technical capabilities at the time of the project's realization, the functionalities, we will integrate those functionalities that are feasible to install. Reference OASIS R4.2.1.6 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 5

Description Specific man-machine interfaces (i.e., between the human operator and the machine) shall be decoupled from the general man-machine interface (i.e., between the man-machine subsystem and the rest of the system). Measure to check One special man-machine interface can be exchanged by another man-machine interface. Rationale The special man-machine interface can be easily exchanged (e.g., using different languages, look-and-feels). Reference GENESYS R4.2.2.1 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 4
